title: Are there any Sami heavy metal bands? - Quora

response.answer_text: None really.  Some Metal bands indeed have used Sámi elements in their music (Shaman, Finntroll, Waltari) but there are no Metal band, to my knowledge, which has described or publicized itself as a "Sámi Metal" band. That said, there are two bands from Northern Sweden and one from Norway who most definitely use Sámi imagery, but it is impossible to say if its members identify as Sámi.  These bands are: Encyclopaedia Metallum: Vetter  Encyclopaedia Metallum: Lönndom  Encyclopaedia Metallum: Saiva  Now there are a handful of Sámi Hard-rock bands such as Intrigue (Intrigue ) or Sagittarius (Encyclopaedia Metallum: The Metal Archives ) which are sometimes kinda Heavy, but not really Metal per se.   Hope this helped !

From what I have read, the Finnish band Shàman is the only exclusively Sami-styled heavy metal band. The vocalist of Shàman sang a few songs for a band named Finntroll. Two other black metal bands have incorporated the joik or "yoik" style of singing in a few of their songs; Barathrum from Finland and Arckanum from Sweden. I acquired all of this information from Wikipedia so there could be many more metal bands that I don't know of. You could also type Sami metal and joik on the Youtube search bar.  I'm sure that will show a few results... I hope this helps.
Korpiklaani might fit the bill, based on their imagery, their earlier lyrics and some of the instruments they use. Another answer listed them, but by their old name, Shaman. Korpiklaani
